Beginner Vocabulary - Page 5

Beginner

Beginner Vocabulary - Page 5

Master basic colors and numbers with this vocabulary page. These words are fundamental for describing the world around you!

Navigation

This is page 5 of 9. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Red

/rɛd/

adjective, noun

Having the color of blood or fire.

"She's wearing a red dress."

Category: Colors

Blue

/bluː/

adjective, noun

Having the color of the sky on a clear day.

"The ocean is blue."

Category: Colors

Green

/ɡriːn/

adjective, noun

Having the color of grass and leaves.

"The trees are green in summer."

Category: Colors

Black

/blæk/

adjective, noun

Having the darkest color, like the night sky.

"I have black hair."

Category: Colors

White

/waɪt/

adjective, noun

Having the color of snow or milk.

"The walls are painted white."

Category: Colors

Yellow

/ˈjɛloʊ/

adjective, noun

Having the color of the sun or gold.

"Bananas are yellow."

Category: Colors

One

/wʌn/

number

The number 1.

"I have one brother."

Category: Numbers

Two

/tuː/

number

The number 2.

"There are two cats in the garden."

Category: Numbers

Three

/θriː/

number

The number 3.

"I have three children."

Category: Numbers

Four

/fɔːr/

number

The number 4.

"The table has four legs."

Category: Numbers

Five

/faɪv/

number

The number 5.

"I wake up at five o'clock."

Category: Numbers

Ten

/tɛn/

number

The number 10.

"I have ten fingers."

Category: Numbers
